page.title: 10OUR LOCAL RIVER
page.content: The River Blythe is basically a clean river and is used for water supply.It rises to the south of Solihull and joins the River Cole near Coleshill. The River Tame,84km.long,drains most of Birmingham and the Black Country. Its'tributaries include the River Rea, Cole,Blythe and Anker.The River Tame is a polluted river,but substantial improvements have taken place in the condition of the rivers Cole and Rea during the course of the last ten years or so.The outfalls of Minworth water reclamation works,the enormous reclamation works which deals with a large part of the Birmingham conurbation,join the River Tame near Curdworth.These effluents have greatly improved in recent years.
